description: To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy  Luke 14: 1, 7-14 - 'Everyone who exalts himself shall be humbled.'  Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs: - 575 (in 'Jesus and Israel') - To be sure, Christ's relations with the Pharisees were not exclusively polemical. Some Pharisees warn him of the danger he was courting; Jesus praises some of them, like the scribe of Mark 12:34, and dines several times at their homes (abbreviated).  Got a Bible question? html_description:
To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy




Luke 14: 1, 7-14 - 'Everyone who exalts himself shall be humbled.'




Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs:


- 575 (in 'Jesus and Israel') - To be sure, Christ's relations with the Pharisees were not exclusively polemical. Some Pharisees warn him of the danger he was courting; Jesus praises some of them, like the scribe of Mark 12:34, and dines several times at their homes (abbreviated).




Got a Bible question? Send an email to logicalbiblestudy@gmail.com, and it will be answered in an upcoming episode!


---
Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/daily-gospel-exegesis/message
name: 22nd Sunday in Ordinary Time (Year C) - Luke 14: 1, 7-14
